author: Erin Morgenstern
review: A mesmerizing fantasy novel set in a magical circus that only opens at night. Morgenstern’s lush descriptions and imaginative storytelling create a truly enchanting experience.

author: Michelle Obama
review: An inspiring memoir by the former First Lady, detailing her journey from childhood to the White House. Obama’s candid and heartfelt narrative provides a deeply personal look at her life and values.

author: Cormac McCarthy
review: A hauntingly beautiful post-apocalyptic novel that explores the bond between a father and his son as they navigate a desolate world. McCarthy’s sparse yet powerful prose conveys deep emotional resonance.

author: Madeline Miller
review: A captivating retelling of the myth of Circe, the enchantress from Homer’s Odyssey. Miller’s novel brings new depth to a classic character with rich prose and an engaging narrative.

bookName: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
author: Mark Manson
review: A refreshing take on personal development that challenges conventional wisdom. Manson’s straightforward advice encourages readers to focus on what truly matters in life.

bookName: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
review: A gripping thriller that combines a murder mystery with a deep dive into Swedish society. Larsson’s intricate plot and compelling characters make for a highly engaging read.

author: Paulo Coelho
review: A philosophical novel about a shepherd’s journey to find his personal legend. Coelho’s tale is both inspiring and thought-provoking, emphasizing the importance of following one's dreams.

bookName: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
author: Rebecca Skloot
review: An extraordinary biography that explores the life of Henrietta Lacks, whose cells were used for groundbreaking medical research without her knowledge. Skloot’s narrative combines scientific and personal history seamlessly.
